original: Ewald, Folke Sigfrid, civilingenjör SVR, mätningsingenjör, Norrköping, f. 9/12/07 i Hälsingborg av förste stadsing. Sigfrid E. o. Karin Hasselgren. — Stud :ex. i Hälsingborg 26, civ:ing:ex. v. KTH (VoV) 31. Res. t. kontinenten f. stud. av gatutrafik o. fotogrammetri i samband m. stadsplanering 33, 37 o. 38. Förste assist, i geodesi v. KTH 31-34, dito i väg-byggn. o. kiommunik :tekn. diär 34-411, biträdde v. stads- o. gen :planearb. inom Norrköp. stadsing :kont. under skilda perioder 35-42, byråing. där 42, mätn:ing. sed. 45. Delt. i stadsplane-tävl. betr. centr. Sthlm 30 o. 33. Bitr. h. sakk. ang. stadsplaneund :visn. 32-33, delt. i utredn. ang. artill. fält-mättj. bl. a. 34-35, sekr. i Sthlms tra-fikkl. 35 o. sen. suppl. i styr. Skr.: ’bitr. prof. H. N. Pafltlin v. utarb. av boken Trafikteknik (36) o. stadsing. John E. Petterson v. utarb. f. Sv. komm:tekn. fören. av Råd o. anvisn. ang. stadskartor (39) samt trafik- o. stadsplaneart. bl. a. i tidskr. Vägen 41-42.
translated: Ewald, Folke Sigfrid, Civil Engineer SVR, Surveying Engineer, Norrköping, b. December 9th, 1907 in Hälsingborg to First City Engineer Sigfrid E. and Karin Hasselgren. Studied in Hälsingborg, passed the engineering exam at KTH (VoV) in 1931. Traveled to the continent for studies in street traffic and photogrammetry in conjunction with urban planning in 1933, 1937, and 1938. First assistant in geodesy at KTH from 1931-1934, and the same in road construction and communication technology from 1934-1941. Assisted in city and general planning work within the Norrköping City Engineering Office during various periods from 1935-1942, becoming a bureau engineer in 1942, and responsible for surveying since 1945. Participated in urban planning competitions for central Stockholm in 1930 and 1933. Provided assistance as a specialist in urban planning from 1932-1933, participated in studies regarding artillery field surveying, and later served as a supplementary member of the governing board for the Stockholm Traffic Committee in 1935. Contributed to the development of the book Traffic Engineering (1936) with Associate Professor H.N. Paftlin, and to the development of guidelines for city maps by the Swedish Committee of Municipal Engineering from 1939. Also contributed articles on traffic and urban planning to the magazine "Vägen" from 1941-1942. Note: "\d\d m. partner's name" indicates that the person got married in the year 19xx.
